sect3.title: Program Files
sect3.para: catchsegv, gencat, getconf, getent, glibcbug, iconv, iconvconfig, ldconfig, ldd, lddlibc4, locale, localedef, mtrace, nscd, nscd_nischeck, pcprofiledump, pt_chown, rpcgen, rpcinfo, sln, sprof, tzselect, xtrace, zdump and zic

sect4.title: catchsegv
sect4.para: catchsegv can be used to create a stack trace when a program terminates with a segmentation fault.

sect4.title: gencat
sect4.para: gencat generates message catalogues.

sect4.title: getconf
sect4.para: getconf displays the system configuration values for filesystem specific variables.

sect4.title: getent
sect4.para: getent gets entries from an administrative database.

sect4.title: glibcbug
sect4.para: glibcbug creates a bug report about glibc and and mails it to the bug email address.

sect4.title: iconv
sect4.para: iconv performs character set conversion.

sect4.title: iconvconfig
sect4.para: iconvconfig creates fastloading iconv module configuration file.

sect4.title: ldconfig
sect4.para: ldconfig configures the dynamic linker run time bindings.

sect4.title: ldd
sect4.para: ldd prints the shared libraries required by each program or shared library specified on the command line.

sect4.title: lddlibc4
sect4.para: lddlibc4 assists ldd with object files.

sect4.title: locale
sect4.para: locale is a Perl program which tells the compiler to enable (or disable) the use of POSIX locales for built-in operations.

sect4.title: localedef
sect4.para: localedef compiles locale specifications.

sect4.title: mtrace
sect4.para: mtrace prints the multicast path from a source to a receiver (an IP trace query).

sect4.title: nscd
sect4.para: nscd is a daemon that provides a cache for the most common name service requests.

sect4.title: nscd_nischeck
sect4.para: nscd_nischeck checks whether or not secure mode is necessary for NIS+ lookup.

sect4.title: pcprofiledump
sect4.para: pcprofiledump dumps information generated by PC profiling.

sect4.title: pt_chown
sect4.para: pt_chown sets the owner, group and access permission of the slave pseudo terminal corresponding to the master pseudo terminal passed on file descriptor `3'. This is the helper program for the `grantpt' function. It is not intended to be run directly from the command line.

sect4.title: rpcgen
sect4.para: rpcgen generates C code to implement the RPC protocol.

sect4.title: rpcinfo
sect4.para: rpcinfo makes an RPC call to an RPC server.

sect4.title: sln
sect4.para: sln symbolically links dest to source. It is statically linked, needing no dynamic linking at all. Thus sln is useful to make symbolic links to dynamic libraries if the dynamic linking system for some reason is nonfunctional.

sect4.title: sprof
sect4.para: sprof reads and displays shared object profiling data.

sect4.title: tzselect
sect4.para: tzselect asks the user for information about the current location and outputs the resulting time zone description to standard output.

sect4.title: xtrace
sect4.para: xtrace traces execution of program by printing the currently executed function.

sect4.title: zdump
sect4.para: zdump is the time zone dumper.

sect4.title: zic
sect4.para: zic is the time zone compiler.

sect4.title: ld.so
sect4.para: ld.so is the helper program for shared library executables.

sect4.title: libBrokenLocale, libBrokenLocale_p
sect4.para: Used by software, such as Mozilla, to solve broken locales.

sect4.title: libSegFault
sect4.para: libSegFault is a segmentation fault signal handler. It tries to catch segfaults.

sect4.title: libanl, libanl_p
sect4.para: libanl is an asynchronous name lookup library.

sect4.title: libbsd-compat
sect4.para: libbsd-compat provides the portability needed in order to run certain programs in Linux.

sect4.title: libc, libc_nonshared, libc_p
sect4.para: These files constitute the main C library. The C library is a collection of commonly used functions in programs. This way a programmer doesn't need to create his own functions for every single task. The most common things like writing a string to the screen are already present and at the disposal of the programmer.

The C library (actually almost every library) comes in two flavors: a dynamic and a static one. In short, when a program uses a static C library, the code from the C library is copied into the executable file. When a program uses a dynamic library, the executable will not contain the code from the C library, but instead a routine that loads the functions from the library at the time the program is run. This means a significant decrease in the file size of a program. The documentation that comes with the C library describes this in more detail, as it is too complicated to explain here in one or two lines.

sect4.title: libcrypt, libcrypt_p
sect4.para: libcrypt is the cryptography library.

sect4.title: libdl, libdl_p
sect4.para: libdl is the dynamic linking interface library.

sect4.title: libg
sect4.para: libg is a runtime library for g++.

sect4.title: libieee
sect4.para: libieee is the IEEE floating point library.

sect4.title: libm, libm_p
sect4.para: libm is the mathematical library.

sect4.title: libmcheck
sect4.para: libmcheck contains code run at boot.

sect4.title: libmemusage
sect4.para: libmemusage is used by memusage to help collect information about the memory usage of a program.

sect4.title: libnsl, libnsl_p
sect4.para: libnsl is the network services library.

sect4.title: libnss_compat, libnss_dns, libnss_files, libnss_hesiod, libnss_nis, libnss_nisplus
sect4.para: The basic idea is to put the implementation of the different services offered to access the databases in separate modules. This has some advantages:

listitem.para: contributors can add new services without adding them to GNU C library,
the modules can be updated separately,
the C library image is smaller.

sect4.title: libpcprofile
sect4.para: Code used by the kernel to track CPU time spent in functions, source code lines, and instructions.

sect4.title: libpthread, libpthread_p
sect4.para: The POSIX threads library.

sect4.title: libresolv, libresolv_p
sect4.para: Functions in this library provide for creating, sending, and interpreting packets to the Internet domain name servers.

sect4.title: librpcsvc, librpcsvc_p
sect4.para: Functions in this library provide miscellaneous RPC services.

sect4.title: librt, librt_p
sect4.para: Functions in this library provide most of the interfaces specified by the POSIX.1b Realtime Extension.

sect4.title: libthread_db
sect4.para: Functions is this library are useful for building debuggers for multi-threaded programs.

sect4.title: libutil, libutil_p
sect4.para: Contains code for "standard" functions used in many different Unix utilities.
